info.title: Business Partners
info.description: Enables you to create and manage business partner data, including customer data, contact data, and customer-contact relationships.

x-sap-extensible.description: The API can be extended by using custom references. For more information, refer to [Custom References](https://help.sap.com/docs/CLOUD_TO_CASH_OD/e4aa21cd43494cc1a8a90ea0f3dab8bb/1a8601ce8db44b2b8e29012d385892ca.html#custom-references) on the SAP Help Portal.

tags.name: Replication Monitoring
tags.description: Monitor SAP Master Data Integration Replication.

get.description:
Retrieves a collection of customers that match the search criteria.

This operation requires the scope `business-partner-customer_view`.

parameters.name: notReplicatedWithExternalSystemId
parameters.description: This query parameter is used to fetch customer data that was not replicated. If this parameter is specified, the query parameter `q` will have no effect on the returned results.

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: The page number to be retrieved where the size of the pages must be specified by the pageSize parameter. The number of the first page is 1.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of records retrieved at one time.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
The list of comma-separated properties used to sort the results.
By default, the column values are sorted in ascending order. 
Can either be in the form of `fieldName`, `fieldName:asc`, or `fieldName:desc`.

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description:
Controls which elements of a customer are expanded (included) in the returned customer.
Available elements are:
    
- `markets` - includes markets information.
- `addresses` - includes all customer addresses.
- `defaultAddress` - includes the default address as defaultAddress property.
- `customReferences` - includes custom references information.
- `all` - includes all markets, addresses, defaultAddress information.

The elements can be combined by separating them with a comma.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description:
The simple query criteria based on available fields to limit returned results or a set of modified documents. A query string contains single or multiple key words. If multiple key words are used, use a space to separate key words. The wildcard (*) is supported to represent one or more characters. If the query parameter q is not specified, only the latest 10 items created will be returned.If you want to search for a value that includes spaces, use '~~' to represent the spaces.Currently, we support the query formats below. Please use these formats to build your query string.
Available formats are:

- `OR` - firstName:Mark company:*ngom* lastName:*ab*
- `AND` - createdAt>2017-06-14T09:07:15.096Z AND customerType:INDIVIDUAL AND externalObjectReferences.externalId!:1
- `OR & AND` - (firstName:Mark company:*ngom* lastName:*a~~b*) AND createdAt>2017-06-14T09:07:15.096Z AND externalObjectReferences.externalId!:1

The following query key words are supported:

- customerNumber
- mdiId
- customerType
- firstName
- lastName
- company
- name
- createdAt
- changedAt
- createdBy
- changedBy
- externalObjectReferences.externalSystemId
- externalObjectReferences.externalId
- externalObjectReferences.externalIdTypeCode
- markets.marketId
- markets.active
- customReferences.typeCode
- customReferences.id
- addresses.email
- addresses.phone
- addresses.street
- addresses.houseNumber
- addresses.city
- addresses.state
- addresses.postalCode
- addresses.country
- addresses.isDefault

The value for createdAt and changedAt must be a UTC date and time in ISO 8601 format, such as: `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`.

parameters.name: $count
parameters.description: If `false`, the response headers `x-count` and `x-pagecount` will not be returned. The recommended setting is `false` if not otherwise required by a special use case, as this results in a significantly faster response time.

x-count.description: The total number of elements that fulfill the criteria.

x-pagecount.description: The total number of pages that fulfill the criteria.

400.description: Your input data is not valid or not in a consistent format. Please check it and try again. You can also check the response payload for more information.

example.message: There are validation problems, see details section for more information

401.description: There is a problem with your token. Generate a new token as described in the API Guide.

example.message: Given request does not have required scopes in access token. It is not authorized to perform this operation.

500.description: There was an error on the server side. If the problem persists, please report the error as described by SAP.

example.message: Something went wrong while processing the request. Please contact the administrator.

503.description: Service unavailable. The server is currently unable to handle the request due to a temporary overloading or maintenance of the server.

get.description:
Retrieves a single customer with a specific identifier.

This operation requires the scope `business-partner-customer_view`.

parameters.description: Specific customer number to identify one customer.

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description:
Controls which elements of a customer are expanded (included) in the returned customer.
Available elements are:
    
- `markets` - includes markets information.
- `addresses` - includes all customer addresses.
- `defaultAddress` - includes the default address as defaultAddress property.
- `customReferences` - includes custom references information.
- `all` - includes all markets, addresses, defaultAddress information.

The elements can be combined by separating them with a comma.

delete.description:
Deletes a single customer with a specific identifier. The customer cannot be deleted when there are existing documents.

This operation requires the scope `business-partner-customer_delete`.

get.description:
Retrieves a collection of contacts that match the search criteria.

This operation requires the scope `business-partner-contact_view`.

parameters.name: notReplicatedWithExternalSystemId
parameters.description: This query parameter is used to fetch contact data that was not replicated. If this parameter is specified, the query parameter **q** will have no effect on the returned results.

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: The page number to be retrieved where the size of the pages must be specified by the pageSize parameter. The number of the first page is 1.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of records retrieved at one time.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
The list of comma-separated properties used to sort the results.
By default, the column values are sorted in ascending order. 
Can either be in the form of `fieldName`, `fieldName:asc`, or `fieldName:desc`.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description:
The simple query criteria based on available fields to limit returned results or a set of modified documents. A query string contains single or multiple key words. If multiple key words are used, use a space to separate key words. The wildcard (*) is supported to represent one or more characters. If the query parameter q is not specified, only the latest 10 items created will be returned.If you want to search for a value that includes spaces, use '~~' to represent the spaces.Currently, we support the query formats below. Please use these formats to build your query string.
Available formats are:

- `OR` - firstName:Mark company:*ngom* lastName:*ab*
- `AND` - createdAt>2017-06-14T09:07:15.096Z AND customerType:INDIVIDUAL AND externalObjectReferences.externalId!:1
- `OR & AND` - (firstName:Mark company:*ngom* lastName:*a~~b*) AND createdAt>2017-06-14T09:07:15.096Z AND externalObjectReferences.externalId!:1

The following query key words are supported:

- contactNumber
- firstName
- lastName
- createdAt
- changedAt
- createdBy
- changedBy
- externalObjectReferences.externalSystemId
- externalObjectReferences.externalId
- externalObjectReferences.externalIdTypeCode

The value for createdAt and changedAt must be a UTC date and time in ISO 8601 format, such as: `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`.

parameters.name: $count
parameters.description: If `false`, the response headers `x-count` and `x-pagecount` will not be returned. The recommended setting is `false` if not otherwise required by a special use case, as this results in a significantly faster response time.

x-count.description: The total number of elements that fulfill the criteria.

x-pagecount.description: The total number of pages that fulfill the criteria.

get.summary: Retrieve relationships between customers and contacts.
get.description:
Retrieves a collection of customer-contact relationships.

This operation requires the scope `business-partner-customer_view`.

parameters.name: notReplicatedWithExternalSystemId
parameters.description: This query parameter is used to fetch customer-contact relationship data that was not replicated. If this parameter is specified, the query parameter `q` will have no effect on the returned results.

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: The page number to be retrieved where the size of the pages must be specified by the pageSize parameter. The number of the first page is 1.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of records retrieved at one time.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
The list of comma-separated properties used to sort the results.
By default, the column values are sorted in ascending order. 
Can either be in the form of `fieldName`, `fieldName:asc`, or `fieldName:desc`.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description:
The simple query criteria based on available fields to limit returned results or a set of modified documents. A query string contains single or multiple key words. If multiple key words are used, use a space to separate key words. The wildcard (*) is supported to represent one or more characters. If the query parameter q is not specified, only the latest 10 items created will be returned.If you want to search for a value that includes spaces, use '~~' to represent the spaces.Currently, we support the query formats below. Please use these formats to build your query string.
Available formats are:

- `OR` - firstName:Mark company:*ngom* lastName:*ab*
- `AND` - createdAt>2017-06-14T09:07:15.096Z AND customerType:INDIVIDUAL AND externalObjectReferences.externalId!:1
- `OR & AND` - (firstName:Mark company:*ngom* lastName:*a~~b*) AND createdAt>2017-06-14T09:07:15.096Z AND externalObjectReferences.externalId!:1

The following query key words are supported:

- customerNumber
- contactNumber
- phone
- email
- createdAt
- changedAt
- createdBy
- changedBy

The value for createdAt and changedAt must be a UTC date and time in ISO 8601 format, such as: `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSZ`.

parameters.name: $count
parameters.description: If `false`, the response headers `x-count` and `x-pagecount` will not be returned. The recommended setting is `false` if not otherwise required by a special use case, as this results in a significantly faster response time.

200.description: Relationships between customers and contacts retrieved successfully.

x-count.description: The total number of elements that fulfill the criteria.

x-pagecount.description: The total number of pages that fulfill the criteria.

put.summary: Creates or updates the customer-contact relationship.
put.description:
Creates or updates the relationship between a customer and a contact with specified IDs.

This operation requires the scope `business-partner-customer_manage`.

parameters.name: customerNumber
parameters.description: Specific customer number to identify one customer.

parameters.name: contactNumber
parameters.description: Specific customer number to identify one customer.

parameters.name: externalSystemId
parameters.description: The ID of the external system that is used for data replication in an integration scenario. When this header is specified, the replication status of the external system will be set to true.

requestBody.description: The customer-contact relationship to be updated.

200.description: Relationship for the given customer and contact created or updated successfully.

400.description: Your input data is not valid or not in a consistent format. Please check it and try again. You can also check the response payload for more information.

example.message: The request payload has incorrect syntax.

401.description: There is a problem with your token. Generate a new token as described in the API Guide.

example.message: Authorization: Unauthorized. Bearer TOKEN is invalid

403.description: You do not have the necessary authorization as defined by the permissions (scopes) assigned to your user.

example.message: Given request does not have required scopes in access token. It is not authorized to perform this operation.

404.description: The specified customer or contact does not exist.

example.message: The requested URI does not map to a single element resource.

412.description: The target object is outdated because it is changed by someone else during processing the request.

example.message: The data you tried to update is not the latest. Please get the latest data.

500.description: There was an error on the server side. If the problem persists, please report the error as described by SAP.

503.description: Service unavailable. The server is currently unable to handle the request due to a temporary overloading or maintenance of the server.

delete.description:
Deletes the relationship between a customer and a contact with specified IDs.

This operation requires the scope `business-partner-customer_manage`.

parameters.name: customerNumber
parameters.description: Specific customer number to identify one customer.

parameters.name: contactNumber
parameters.description: Specific customer number to identify one customer.

parameters.name: externalSystemId
parameters.description: The ID of the external system that is used for data replication in an integration scenario. When this header is specified, the replication status of the external system will be set to true.

204.description: Relationship for the given customer and contact deleted successfully.

401.description: There is a problem with your token. Generate a new token as described in the API Guide.

example.message: Authorization: Unauthorized. Bearer TOKEN is invalid

403.description: You do not have the necessary authorization as defined by the permissions (scopes) assigned to your user.

example.message: Given request does not have required scopes in access token. It is not authorized to perform this operation.

404.description: The specified customer-contact relationship does not exist.

example.message: The requested URI does not map to a single element resource.

example.message: Something went wrong while processing the request. Please contact the administrator.

503.description: Service unavailable. The server is currently unable to handle the request due to a temporary overloading or maintenance of the server.

post.description:

This operation requires the scope `business-partner-customer_manage`.

post.summary: Confirms replication of the customer-contact relationship.

get.summary: Retrieves SAP Master Data Integration business partner replication reports.
get.description:
Retrieves a collection of SAP Master Data Integration replication reports that match the search criteria.

This operation requires the scope `business-partner-mdi-replication-report_view`.

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: The page number to be retrieved where the size of the pages must be specified by the pageSize parameter. The number of the first page is 1.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of records retrieved at one time.

parameters.name: replicationStatus
parameters.description: Filter SAP Master Data Integration replication reports by replication status: `NOT_STARTED`, `FAILURE`, `SKIPPED`, or `SUCCESS`.

parameters.name: mdiId
parameters.description: Filter SAP Master Data Integration replication reports by SAP Master Data Integration instance identifier.

parameters.name: customerNumber
parameters.description: Filter SAP Master Data Integration replication reports by SAP Subscription Billing customer number.

parameters.name: $count
parameters.description: If `false`, the response headers `x-count` and `x-pagecount` will not be returned. The recommended setting is `false` if not otherwise required by a special use case, as this results in a significantly faster response time.

200.description: SAP Master Data Integration replication reports retrieved successfully.

x-count.description: The total number of elements that fulfill the criteria.

x-pagecount.description: The total number of pages that fulfill the criteria.

failureReason.message: The specified market does not exist: [1090, 10, 00].

400.description: Your input data is not valid or not in a consistent format. Please check it and try again. You can also check the response payload for more information.

example.message: There are validation problems, see details section for more information

401.description: There is a problem with your token. Generate a new token as described in the API Guide.

example.message: Authorization: Unauthorized. Bearer TOKEN is invalid

403.description: You do not have the necessary authorization as defined by the permissions (scopes) assigned to your user.

example.message: Given request does not have required scopes in access token. It is not authorized to perform this operation.

example.message: Something went wrong while processing the request. Please contact the administrator.

503.description: Service unavailable. The server is currently unable to handle the request due to a temporary overloading or maintenance of the server.

mdiId.description: The identifier of the business partner instance in SAP Master Data Integration if this customer is replicated from SAP Master Data Integration.

personalInfo.description: Mandatory fields for an individual customer that will be ignored when a corporate customer is created.

firstName.description: First name of an individual customer.

lastName.description: Last name of an individual customer. Mandatory field for personal information.

corporateInfo.description: Mandatory fields for a corporate customer that will be ignored when an individual customer is created.

company.description: Company name of the corporate customer.

items.description:
The customer identifier replicated from an external system. This reference contains the ID and type of the external system, the external ID of the customer, and the ID stored on the database of the external system. 
The composite key of `externalSystemId` and `externalIdTypeCode` must be unique.

externalSystemId.description: The identifier of an external system from which the customer data is replicated.

externalIdTypeCode.description: The type of the external customer identifier replicated from an external system. The predefined codes are 201: Business Partner Number, 202: ERP Customer Number, 203: ERP Customer Number on Database, 211: Contract Account Number. Customized codes must start with the uppercase letter Z.

externalId.description: The external customer identifier replicated from an external system.

typeCode.description: The code representing the type of the reference.

createdBy.description: The user that created the customer.

changedBy.description: The user that changed the customer.

createdAt.description: The date and time the customer was created.

changedAt.description: The date and time the customer was changed.

addresses.description: The list of customer addresses. Currently, only one address is supported.

addressUUID.description: The unique identifier of the address.

additionalAddressInfo.description: Additional information about the address that may provide country-specific details.

houseNumber.description: The house number of the address.

postalCode.description: The postal code of the address.

country.description: The country / region of the address.

isDefault.description: If true, the address is the default address.

markets.description: The list of the markets assigned to a customer.

items.description: The market assigned to a customer.

country.description: The country / region of a market.

salesArea.description: The sales area information of a market.

salesOrganization.description: The sales organization of a market.

distributionChannel.description: The distribution channel of a market.

active.description: If true, this market is active.

priceInfo.description:
Note: These fields are currently not used.
The market price information from an external system.

priceGroup.description: The price group from an external system. The price group is a group of customers who share the same pricing requirements.

priceListType.description: The price list type from an external system. The price list type defines the type and characteristics of a price list.

incoterms.description: The market incoterms from an external system. Incoterms are a codification for commonly-used trading terms.

incotermsLocation.description: Additional incoterms information regarding the location.

contactNumber.description: The unique identifier of a contact.

lastName.description: Last name of a contact. Mandatory field for personal information.

items.description:
The contact identifier replicated from an external system. This reference contains the ID and type of the external system, the external ID of the customer, and the ID stored on the database of the external system. 
The composite key of `externalSystemId` and `externalIdTypeCode` must be unique.

externalSystemId.description: The identifier of an external system from which the customer data is replicated.

externalIdTypeCode.description: The type of the external customer identifier replicated from an external system. The predefined codes are 201: Business Partner Number, 202: ERP Customer Number, 203: ERP Customer Number on Database, 211: Contract Account Number. Customized codes must start with the uppercase letter Z.

externalId.description: The external customer identifier replicated from an external system.

createdBy.description: The user that created the contact.

changedBy.description: The user that changed the contact.

createdAt.description: The date and time the contact was created.

changedAt.description: The date and time the contact was changed.

customerNumber.description: The identifying number assigned to this customer. If the field is empty, a random number will be generated. If the field contains digits only, the leading zero will be removed.

mdiId.description: The corresponding SAP Master Data Integration instance identifier associated with this customer. It's immutable once it has been set.

personalInfo.description: Mandatory fields for an individual customer that will be ignored when a corporate customer is created.

lastName.description: Last name of the customer. Mandatory field for personal information.

corporateInfo.description: Mandatory fields for a corporate customer that will be ignored when an individual customer is created.

company.description: Company name of the corporate customer.

externalObjectReferenceListCompleteIndic.description: Indicates whether the external object references list is complete. The default value is `false`, meaning that the list should merge with original list.

items.description:
The customer identifier replicated from an external system. This reference contains the ID and type of the external system, the external ID of the customer, and the ID stored on the database of the external system. 
The composite key of `externalSystemId` and `externalIdTypeCode` must be unique.

externalSystemId.description: The identifier of an external system from which the customer data is replicated.

externalIdTypeCode.description: The type of external customer identifier replicated from an external system. The predefined codes are 201: Business Partner Number, 202: ERP Customer Number, 203: ERP Customer Number on Database, 211: Contract Account Number. Customized codes must start with the uppercase letter Z.

externalId.description: The external customer identifier replicated from an external system.

typeCode.description: The code representing the type of the reference.

addresses.description: The list of customer addresses. Currently, only one address is supported. Whether the street, city, state and postalCode fields in the address are mandatory depends on the `AddressSettings` configuration value in Business Configuration for different countries. When the `completenessCheckActivation` value is set to `false`, no specific field is mandatory. When the `completenessCheckActivation` value is set to `true`, then check whether the specific field value for the country / region is true under `countrySpecificSettings`. For example, if the value of street is `true`, the street field is mandatory.

addressUUID.description: The unique identifier of the address. If this field is empty, a random ID is generated.

additionalAddressInfo.description: Additional information about the address that may provide country-specific details.

houseNumber.description: The house number of the address.

postalCode.description: The postal code of the address.

country.description: The country / region of the address.

isDefault.description: If true, this address is the default address.

markets.description: The list of the markets assigned to a customer.

items.description: The market assigned to a customer.

marketId.description: The identifier of the market assigned to a customer.

salesArea.description: The sales area information of the market that should be matched to one of the markets defined within the business configuration. If a matched market cannot be found, just ignore this salesArea.

salesOrganization.description: The sales organization of a market.

distributionChannel.description: The distribution channel of a market.

active.description: If true, the market is active.

externalSystemType.description: The type of an external system the customer data is replicated from.

externalSystemId.description: The identifier of an external system the customer data is replicated from.

externalIdTypeCode.description: The code represents the type of the external customer identifier replicated from an external system. The predefined codes are 201: Business Partner Number, 202: ERP Customer Number, 203: ERP Customer Number on Database, 211: Contract Account Number. Customized codes must start with the uppercase letter Z.

externalId.description: The external customer identifier replicated from an external system.

resourceLocation.title: Resource Location
resourceLocation.description: The schema showing the location of the new resource.

id.description: The identifier of the created resource.

status.description: original HTTP error code, should be consistent with the response HTTP code

type.description: classification of the error type, lower case with underscore eg validation_failure

details.description: list of problems causing this error

field.description: a bean notation expression specifying the element in request data causing the error, eg product.variants[3].name, this can be empty if violation was not field specific

type.description: classification of the error detail type, lower case with underscore eg missing_value, this value must be always interpreted in context of the general error type.

message.description: descriptive error detail message for debugging

contactNumber.description: The identifying number assigned to this contact. If the field is empty, a random number will be generated. If the field contains digits only, the leading zero will be removed.

lastName.description: Last name of the contact. Mandatory field for personal information.

externalObjectReferenceListCompleteIndic.description: Indicates whether the external object references list is complete. The default value is `false`, meaning that the list should merge with the original list.

items.description:
The contact identifier replicated from an external system. This reference contains the ID and type of the external system, the external ID of the customer, and the ID stored on the database of the external system. 
The composite key of `externalSystemId` and `externalIdTypeCode` must be unique.

externalSystemId.description: The identifier of an external system from which the customer data is replicated.

externalIdTypeCode.description: The type of external customer identifier replicated from an external system. The predefined codes are 201: Business Partner Number, 202: ERP Customer Number, 203: ERP Customer Number on Database, 211: Contract Account Number. Customized codes must start with the uppercase letter Z.

externalId.description: The external customer identifier replicated from an external system.

customerNumber.description: The identifying number assigned to this customer. If the filed is empty, a random number will be generated.

mdiId.description: The corresponding SAP Master Data Integration instance identifier associated with this customer. It's immutable once it has been set.

personalInfo.description: Mandatory fields for an individual customer that will be ignored when a corporate customer is created.

lastName.description: Last name of the customer. Mandatory field for personal information.

corporateInfo.description: Mandatory fields for a corporate customer that will be ignored when an individual customer is created.

company.description: Company name of the corporate customer.

externalObjectReferenceListCompleteIndic.description: Indicate whether the external object references list is complete. The default value is false, which means the list should merge with original list.

items.description: The customer identifier replicated from an external system. This reference contains the ID and type of the external system, the external ID of the customer, and the ID stored on the database of the external system.

externalSystemId.description: The identifier of an external system the customer data is replicated from.

externalIdTypeCode.description: The code representing the type of the external customer identifier replicated from an external system. The predefined codes are 201: Business Partner Number, 202: ERP Customer Number, 203: ERP Customer Number on Database. Customized codes must start with the uppercase letter Z.

externalId.description: The external customer identifier replicated from an external system.

typeCode.description: The code representing the type of the reference.

addresses.description: The list of customer addresses. Currently, only one address is supported. Whether the street, city, state and postalCode fields in the address are mandatory depends on the AddressSettings configuration value in Business Configuration for different countries. When the completenessCheckActivation value is set to false, no specific field is mandatory. When the completenessCheckActivation value is set to true, then check whether the specific field value for the country / region is true under countrySpecificSettings. For example, if the value of street is true, the street field is mandatory.

addressUUID.description: The unique identifier of the address. If this field is empty, the ID of the default address is assigned.

additionalAddressInfo.description: Additional information about the address that may provide country-specific details.

houseNumber.description: The house number of the address.

postalCode.description: The postal code of the address.

country.description: The country / region of the address.

isDefault.description: If true, this address is the default address.

markets.description: The list of the markets assigned to a customer.

items.description: The market assigned to a customer.

marketId.description: The identifier of the market assigned to a customer.

salesArea.description: The sales area information of the market that should be matched to one of the markets defined within the business configuration. If a matched market cannot be found, just ignore this salesArea.

salesOrganization.description: The sales organization of a market.

distributionChannel.description: The distribution channel of a market.

active.description: If true, the market is active.

contactNumber.description: The unique identifier of a contact.

changedBy.description: The user who changed the relationship.

createdAt.description: The date and time when the relationship was created.

changedAt.description: The date and time when the relationship was changed.

isDefault.description: The default flag for this relationship.

workplaceAddress.description: The address of a contact related to the specific customer.

addressUUID.description: The unique identifier of the address. If this field is empty, a random ID is generated when a new relationship is created.

email.description: The email address of a contact.

phone.description: The phone number of a contact.

isDefault.description: The default property of a contact. Only the value `true` is accepted.

externalSystemType.description: The type of an external system the customer data is replicated from.

externalSystemId.description: The identifier of an external system the customer data is replicated from.

externalIdTypeCode.description: The code represents the type of the external customer identifier replicated from an external system. The predefined codes are 201: Business Partner Number, 202: ERP Customer Number, 203: ERP Customer Number on Database, 211: Contract Account Number. Customized codes must start with the uppercase letter Z.

externalId.description: The external customer identifier replicated from an external system.

mdiId.description: The identifier of the business partner instance in SAP Master Data Integration

customerNumber.description: The Identifier of the Business Partner instance in SAP Subscription Billing

changedAt.description: The date and time the replication event was last changed.

code.description: The code for the failure reason.

message.description: The detailed error message of the failure reason.

oauth2.description:
To use this API, log on to the SAP BTP (Business Technology Platform) cockpit to get a service key with OAuth client credentials. Then use the service key to generate an access/bearer token.
For more information, see the API Guide.

scopes.{identityzone}.business-partner-mdi-repl: View SAP Master Data Integration Replication reports.

x-sap-shortText: Manage business partners, including customers and contacts.
